main event: A witness reported seeing two unidentified silvery objects in the sky over Troy, Ohio on September 7, 1961.
interesting points: The objects were observed for approximately 5 minutes,The first object resembled a satellite while the second was luminous and followed closely behind,The witness described the objects moving in a SW-NE trajectory and mentioned a sharp angle stop lasting for 5 seconds,There was speculation that the objects could be mistaken for satellites, balloons, or aircraft,The sighting included hand-drawn sketches of the observed objects' shapes and trajectories.
sighted object: two silvery objects in the sky
witness description: A 35-year-old weather man with 10 years of written experience in the field
